h1.aria-label: April 26, 2020 PUSD Message (Family Survey, Grading Policy)
h1.span: April 26, 2020 PUSD Message (Family Survey, Grading Policy)

div.p: As we begin our seventh week of remote instruction and learning, I want to thank you all for everything you are doing to support the students of the Pasadena Unified School District. We are fortunate to have a hard-working staff, dedicated students, supportive parents and caregivers, and caring community partners.

p.span: I am so proud of the PUSD team! School principals, teachers, and staff at schools are working hard to lift students spirits. For example, Altadena Arts Magnet Principal Benita Scheckel hosts

a.span: Storytime with the Principal on Facebook Live

p.span: , posts videos regularly, and led a car parade of teachers and administrators to drive by students homes.
Blair High School Principal David Ibarra and faculty saluted seniors with a
. Marshall Fundamental Principal Mark Anderson and the Marshall Staff Masked Singers also created a fun and engaging
. There are many more stories like these, and I will keep sharing these with you.

To better understand how PUSD and our community partners can best serve our students, staff, families, and caregivers during the physical closure of our schools, PUSD is conducting a Family Needs Assessment Survey. We invite you to participate in a short 3 to 5-minute confidential survey. The survey ends on May 3, 2020. We appreciate your anticipated participation.

p.b: Below is information for the coming week that I hope will be helpful to you.

p.span: PUSD has altered its grading policy in collaboration with the United Teachers of Pasadena (UTP) to ensure that students and staff are equitably supported for success and in accordance with the California Department of Educations guidance that no student should be harmed through grading during COVID-19 and extended distance learning.
Beginning on March 16, 2020, and ending on May 28, 2020, grading will be as follows:

li.span: students in grades K-5 will receive Pass/No Pass grades for Trimester 3 grading period only.

: Middle and High School students will receive grades from A-D only during marking periods 7 and 8 and the final semester grade. Student grades marked on March 13, 2020, are the lowest grade any student can receive during this time. Students who received an F as of March 13 will be given additional opportunities to increase their grade if afforded access to their classes and teachers. Students will not be assigned Incomplete, F or NG grades if they are unable to increase their grade during the Extended Distance Learning time due to their inability to access their education for technology and/or social emotional reasons.

li.b: Rose City High School: March 13 was the last day of Quarter 3 at Rose City High School, a model continuation school. Remote learning began on March 16, the same day as the schools start of Quarter 4. Rose City High School students will receive a grade no lower than C for this Quarter and receive five full credits per course.

p.span: In support of our seniors in the Class of 2020, the PUSD graduation requirements have been slightly modified for completion of community service/work-based learning hours and the graduate defense.
Please see the

a.span: letter from PUSD Chief Academic Officer Dr. Elizabeth Blanco

p.span: for further information about graduation requirements, graduation survey of seniors, Advanced Placement Testing, English Learner reclassification, and more.

PUSD is moving to an online enrollment process for 2020-2021. District staff is finalizing the new online enrollment process for new students and Open Enrollment second lottery participants for the 2020-2021 school year. The online enrollment process and registration dates for second lottery participants will be shared with you this week. Waitlists for second lottery participants will be maintained until August 7, 2020. Families should periodically sign into their Smart Choice account to determine their waitlist status. If you have specific questions regarding open enrollment, please contact the

a.span: Office of Enrollment, Permits, and Student Records.

p.span: Please continue to check our dedicated website at
for the latest information or call the PUSD Family Hotline at 626.396.3680.
We continue to follow Safer at Home public health orders and will communicate with you as information develops.
Let's have a great week!
Brian McDonald
Superintendent
26 de abril de 2020

hr.p: Estimada comunidad de PUSD:

Al comenzar nuestra sptima semana de instruccin y aprendizaje remoto, quiero agradecerles a todos por todo lo que estn haciendo para apoyar a los estudiantes del Distrito Escolar Unificado de Pasadena. Somos afortunados de contar con un personal que trabaja arduamente, estudiantes dedicados, padres/tutores cuidadosos, y socios comunitarios atentos.

p.span: Estoy muy orgulloso del equipo de PUSD! Los directores, los maestros y el personal de las escuelas estn trabajando arduamente para elevar el nimo de los estudiantes. Por ejemplo, la directora de Altadena Arts Magnet, la Dra. Benita Scheckel, presenta

a.span: Storytime with the Principal en Facebook Live

p.span: , publica videos regularmente y organiz un desfile automotriz de maestros y administradores que paso por en frente de los hogares de sus estudiantes. El director de la escuela secundaria Blair, David Ibarra, y la facultad saludaron a los estudiantes de ltimo ao con
. El director de la escuela Marshall Fundamental, el Dr. Mark Anderson, y los cantantes enmascarados del personal de Marshall tambin crearon
divertido. Hay muchas ms historias como estas, y seguir compartindolas con ustedes.

Para poder entender mejor de qu manera PUSD y nuestros aliados comunitarios pueden servir mejor a nuestra comunidad, estamos recopilando su opinin durante el lapso en que las escuelas continan cerradas. Lo invitamos a participar en una breve encuesta confidencial de 3 a 5 minutos. La encuesta finaliza el 3 de mayo de 2020. Agradecemos su participacin.

p.b: A continuacin hay informacin para la prxima semana que espero sea de utilidad.

p.span: PUSD ha alterado su poltica de calificacin, en colaboracin con United Teachers of Pasadena (UTP) para garantizar que los estudiantes y el personal reciban un apoyo equitativo para el xito y de acuerdo con la orientacin del Departamento de Educacin de California de que "ningn estudiante debera verse perjudicado por la calificacin durante COVID -19 y aprendizaje a distancia extendida ". A partir del 16 de marzo de 2020 y hasta el 28 de mayo de 2020.

li.span: : los estudiantes en los grados K-5 recibirn calificaciones de Pase / No Pase solo para el perodo de calificaciones del Trimestre 3.

: los estudiantes de secundaria y preparatoria recibirn calificaciones de A-D solo durante los perodos de calificaciones 7 y 8, y la calificacin final del semestre. Las calificaciones de los estudiantes marcadas el 13 de marzo de 2020 son las calificaciones ms bajas que cualquier estudiante puede recibir durante este tiempo. Los estudiantes que recibieron una "F" a partir del 13 de marzo tendrnoportunidades adicionales para aumentar su calificacin si tienen acceso a sus clases y maestros. A los estudiantes no se les asignarn calificaciones "incompletas", "F" o "NG" si no pueden aumentar su calificacin durante el tiempo de Aprendizaje a Distancia Extendido debido a su incapacidad para acceder a su educacin por razones tecnolgicas y / o sociales y emocionales.

Rose City High School: el 13 de marzo fue el ltimo da del tercer trimestre en Rose City High School, una escuela de continuacin de educacin. El aprendizaje remoto comenz el 16 de marzo, el mismo da que comenz la escuela en el cuarto trimestre. Los estudiantes de Rose City High School recibirn una calificacin no inferior a "C" para este trimestre y recibirn cinco crditos completos por curso.

p.span: En apoyo de nuestros estudiantes de ltimo ao en la Clase de 2020, los requisitos de graduacin del PUSD se han modificado ligeramente para completar el servicio comunitario / horas de aprendizaje basadas en el trabajo y la defensa de graduados.

strong.a: Consulte la carta de la Directora Acadmica del PUSD, Dra. Elizabeth Blanco

p.span: , para obtener ms informacin sobre los requisitos de graduacin, la encuesta para estudiantes sobre graduacin, los examenede Colocacin Avanzada, la reclasificacin de aprendices de ingls, y ms.

PUSD se est moviendo a un proceso de inscripcin en lnea para 2020-2021. El personal del distrito est finalizando el nuevo proceso de inscripcin en lnea para los nuevos estudiantes y los participantes de la segunda lotera de Inscripcin Abierta para el ao escolar 2020-2021. El proceso de inscripcin en lnea y las fechas de inscripcin para los participantes de la segunda lotera se compartirn con usted esta semana. Las listas de espera para los participantes de la segunda lotera se mantendrn hasta el 7 de agosto de 2020. Las familias deben registrarse peridicamente en su cuenta Smart Choice para determinar su estado en la lista de espera. Si tiene preguntas especficas sobre la inscripcin abierta, comunquese con la

a.span: Oficina de Inscripcin, Permisos y Expedientes del Estudiante.

p.span: Contine visitando nuestro sitio web dedicado en
para obtener la informacin ms reciente o llame a la lnea directa familiar de PUSD al 626.396.3680.
Continuamos siguiendo las rdenes de salud pblica Ms Seguros en Casa y nos comunicaremos con usted a medida que se desarrolle la informacin.

hr.p: Que tengamos una gran semana!
Atentamente,

p.span: Brian McDonald
Superintendente

div.p: To ensure that students and staff are equitably supported for success and in accordance with the California Department of Educations guidance that no student should be harmed through grading during COVID-19 and extended distance learning, PUSD has altered its grading policy, in collaboration with the United Teachers of Pasadena (UTP). March 13, 2020 was the last day that students were physically in classrooms. Beginning on March 16, 2020 and ending on May 28, 2020,

ul.li:
Elementary School: students in grades K-5 will receive Pass/No Pass grades for Trimester 3 grading
period only.

Middle and High School: Middle and High School students will receive grades from A-D only during
marking periods 7 and 8, and the final semester grade. Student grades marked on March 13, 2020 are the
lowest grade any student can receive during this time. Students who received an F as of March 13 will be
given additional opportunities to increase their grade if afforded access to their classes and teachers.
Students will not be assigned incomplete, F or NG grades if they are unable to increase their grade
during the Extended Distance Learning time due to their inability to access their education for technology
and/or social emotional reasons.

Rose City High School: March 13 was the last day of Quarter 3 at Rose City High School, a model
continuation school. Remote learning began on March 16, the same day as the schools start of Quarter 4.
Rose City High School students will receive a grade no lower than C for this Quarter, and receive five
full credits per course.

a.aria-label: See the Memorandum of Understanding PUSD/United Teachers of Pasadena - Opens a new window

p.a: See the Memorandum of Understanding PUSD/United Teachers of Pasadena

p.span: I hope that you are staying healthy.
Sinceschools were dismissed,PUSD has served more than
61,000 meals to children in our community.
The number of meals served has been rising every week and we remain committed to serving our students and families.

div.p: I want to thank PUSD food service workers, volunteers, and all those carrying out essential duties for their work in support of our students and families. I also want to thank all of you for staying at home to flatten the curve and protect our entire community. Your steadfast resolve demonstrates the best of PUSD and the abiding care that we have for each other. It is what makes PUSD remarkable and what will lead us to meeting in person again.

p.span: With the latest information and projections from L.A. County Health authorities, we are planning for PUSD summer activities along two possible paths: in-person and virtual, although it seems more likely that any summer activities will be held in a virtual environment. Governor Newsom has indicated that schools should plan for remote learning this summer and modified structures in the next school year. We are carefully examining our options and will share with you further information as summer plans are finalized.

PUSD is moving to an online enrollment process for 2020-2021. District staff is finalizing an online enrollment process for new students and Open Enrollment second lottery participants for the 2020-2021 school year. The online enrollment process and registration dates for second lottery participants will be shared with you shortly.

Waitlists for second lottery participants will be maintained until August 7, 2020. Families should periodically sign into their Smart Choice account to determine their waitlist status. If you have specific questions regarding open enrollment, please contact the

a.span: Office of Enrollment, Permits, and Student Records.

p.span: Students in the graduating Class of 2020 are very much on our minds. Were pleased to hear the many stories about our students college acceptances and plans after graduation. Graduations ceremonies are one of the most memorable rites of passage, and the PUSD team and I are committed to honoring our graduates and their families. The Academics team, along with high school principals, are exploring possible ways to celebrate graduation ceremonies and other traditional senior events, whether through postponement or a different format. Were calling them Seniorbrations and will share details with you as soon as they are finalized. Our plans are of course subject to the latest guidelines and recommendations from the State and public health authorities.
We are pleased to launch
, a dedicated website that brings together PUSDs information and resources about our response to COVID-19 in a single place. Our main website at
is still active with information about our academic programs, enrollment, Board meetings, etc.
Our remote learning is moving to the next phase,
with additional opportunities for live interaction between students and teachers via office hours and virtual meetings. Updated remote learning guidelines, along with tips for families, are posted
PUSD Food Services offers free meals to children 18 and younger at
. PUSD serves prepackaged curbside breakfast and lunch weekdays from 9 - 11 a.m. The City of Pasadena offers lunch for students and their families on weekends.

I want to share with you that we continue to be concerned about the social and emotional well-being of our students. Professional counselors are available to talk with students by calling the PUSD Family Hotline at 626.396.3680. Information about additional support for students and their families is available
. We are working with school principals and staff to identify and address the needs of our students, along with any barriers they may have in accessing learning.

p.b: LCAP Surveys Close April 21 at 2 p.m.
p.span: Complete your LCAP Survey by 2 p.m. on April 21! PUSD is conducting a series of surveys to gather input from students, parents, staff, and community members as part of the development of the Local Control Accountability Plan (LCAP).
PUSDs ITS is now providing direct support for PUSD-managed devices and applications for students. Students can now submit their own support tickets by visiting

while logged in to their PUSD accounts. Families can also reach the ITS HelpDesk at 626-396-3699 in order to get real time support. Please visit the following URLs for support regarding other student needs:

li.span: If you are experiencing issues with Powerschool learning, please visit
for updates.
Students who need support with lost or stolen devices, please submit tickets at
Please continue to submit requests for Hotspots at
. However, we are currently out of hotspots but waiting to receive more. Hotspots will be checked out on a first come first serve basis based on when tickets are submitted.
For weekly ITS updates, please check your students email every Tuesday for our Tech Bytes newsletter, and visit

p.span: Now more than ever, the PUSD community needs you. And you can make a BIG difference without even leaving the house. Visit
and complete your census form -- and make sure that every child is counted. You can complete the Census online or by phone in multiple languages. Please visit our website for more information:
PUSDs Office of Family and Community Engagement is launching the
. Parents and Community members will have access to join virtual Parent University workshops and scheduled District Parent Group Meetings. The

, which launches April 20, offers live streamed and pre-recorded sessions of Parent University workshops with topics from social-emotional trauma, vaping, and school safety, among others. Workshop topics and district parent group meeting sessions will be updated on a weekly basis, allowing users to attend as many virtual sessions as they like. Mark your calendars! Family Engagement PowerSchool page will launch Monday, April 20 at
Please check our website at
for the latest news and information or call the PUSD Family Hotline at 626.396.3680.
Brian McDonald
Superintendent

hr.p: Espero que todos estn bien de salud.

Desde que se cerraron las escuelas, , PUSD ha servido ms de 61,000 comidas a nios en nuestra comunidad. El nmero de comidas servidas ha aumentado cada semana y seguimos comprometidos a servir a nuestros estudiantes y sus familias.

Quiero agradecer a los trabajadores del servicio de alimentos del PUSD, a los voluntarios y a todos aquellos que llevan a cabo tareas esenciales en apoyo de nuestros estudiantes y familias. Tambin quiero agradecerles a todos ustedes por quedarse en casa para aplanar la curva y proteger a toda nuestra comunidad. Su firme resolucin demuestra lo mejor de PUSD y la atencin que tenemos el uno para el otro. Es lo que hace que el PUSD sea notable y lo que nos llevar a reunirnos en persona nuevamente.

p.b: Planes de aprendizaje en el verano
p.span: Con la informacin y las proyecciones ms recientes de las autoridades de salud del condado de Los ngeles, estamos planeando actividades de verano del PUSD a lo largo de dos caminos posibles: en persona y virtuales, aunque parece ms probable que las actividades de verano se realicen en un entorno virtual.. El Gobernador Newsom ha indicado que las escuelas deben planear para aprendizaje remoto este verano y estructuras de aprendizaje modificadas en el prximo ao escolar. Estamos examinando cuidadosamente nuestras opciones y compartiremos con usted ms informacin a medida que finalicen los planes de verano.

PUSD se est moviendo a un proceso de inscripcin en lnea para el ao escolar 2020-2021. El personal del distrito est finalizando un proceso de inscripcin en lnea para los nuevos estudiantes y los participantes de la segunda lotera de Inscripcin Abierta. El proceso de inscripcin en lnea y las fechas de inscripcin para los participantes de la segunda lotera se compartirn con usted prximamente.

Las listas de espera para los participantes de la segunda lotera se mantendrn hasta el 7 de agosto de 2020. Las familias deben registrarse peridicamente en su cuenta Smart Choice para determinar su estado en la lista de espera. Si tiene preguntas especficas sobre la inscripcin abierta, comunquese con la

a.span: Oficina de Inscripcin, Permisos y Expedientes del Estudiante

p.span: Tenemos muy en mente a los alumnos en la clase graduada de 2020. Nos complace escuchar las muchas noticias sobre las aceptaciones y planes universitarios de nuestros estudiantes despus de graduacin. Las ceremonias de graduacin son uno de los ritos de paso ms memorables, y el equipo de PUSD y yo estamos comprometidos a honrar a nuestros graduados y sus familias. El equipo acadmico, junto con los directores de las escuelas preparatorias, estn explorando posibles formas de celebrar las ceremonias de graduacin y otros eventos tradicionales, ya sea mediante aplazamiento o en un formato diferente. Los llamamos "Seniorbrations" y compartiremos detalles con usted tan pronto como se finalicen. Por supuesto, nuestros planes estn sujetos a las ltimas pautas y recomendaciones de las autoridades estatales y de salud pblica.

p.span: Our District moves to Stage 2 of remote learning from April 6 - 20. In this phase, teacher-provided content intended for ongoing use will be available via PowerSchool Learning at
. The next phase begins April 20; we will send you detailed information in the coming days.

div.p: Goals for remote learning

li.span: To maintain relationships within our learning community
To reinforce learning and minimize skill regression
To connect
all
students to the most essential learning

p.span: Guiding Principles

li.span: We prioritize the relationships and mental well-being of all members of our learning community. Much of this is as new to teachers as it is to families and students, so we encourage patience and flexibility as we navigate this unusual setting together.
. When covering new content, we have asked teachers to focus on only the most essential topics. Anticipate covering
significantly less
content than would normally be accomplished in an in-person setting. All students are facing this situation and schools will make future adjustments.

PUSD will prioritize asynchronous lessons and assignments that can be accessed at times convenient to the family. However, live office hours or meetings may be offered at pre-scheduled times.

p.span: April 5, 2020

div.p: Dear PUSD Community,

p.span: As we return from Spring Break, I hope that you and your family are safe and healthy. In just a matter of weeks, life has changed in so many ways but we have all, as one great community, come together to support each other. I want to thank our teachers, principals, and the staff from school and central offices who are working so hard to continue teaching, learning, and supporting our students and families. I also want to thank our students, parents and caregivers for the patience and support youve demonstrated during these trying, rapidly changing times.

div.p: There is no question that this is hard, but I know that together we will do our very best every day not only to adjust to our new circumstances but to emerge from this stronger and with a clear vision of our future. With our response to this crisis, we must continue to model the 21st century skills that we are teaching our students: to be creative problem-solvers, to communicate effectively, to apply critical thinking, and to collaborate. We are confident that our Districts response, in partnership with you, will help our students come out of this strong, healthy, and ready to thrive.

hr.p: 5 de abril de 2020
Estimada comunidad de PUSD:

Al regresar de las vacaciones de primavera, espero que usted y su familia estn seguros y saludables. En cuestin de semanas, la vida ha cambiado de muchas maneras, pero todos, como una gran comunidad, nos hemos unido para apoyarnos mutuamente. Quiero agradecer a nuestros maestros, directores y al personal de la escuela y las oficinas centrales que estn trabajando tan duro para continuar enseando, aprendiendo y apoyando a nuestros estudiantes y familias. Tambin quiero agradecer a nuestros estudiantes, padres y cuidadores por la paciencia y el apoyo que han demostrado durante estos tiempos difciles que cambian rpidamente.

No hay duda de que esto es difcil, pero s que juntos haremos nuestro mejor esfuerzo todos los das, no solo para adaptarnos a nuestras nuevas circunstancias, sino tambin para salir de esto ms fuerte y con una visin clara de nuestro futuro. Con nuestra respuesta a esta crisis, debemos seguir modelando las habilidades del siglo XXI que les estamos enseando a nuestros estudiantes: ser creativos para resolver problemas, comunicarse de manera efectiva, aplicar el pensamiento crtico, y colaborar. Confiamos en que la respuesta de nuestro Distrito, en asociacin con usted, ayudar a nuestros estudiantes a salir de esta situacin fuertes, saludables y listos para prosperar.

h1.aria-label: April 1, 2020: Remote Learning to End of School Year
h1.span: April 1, 2020: Remote Learning to End of School Year

div.p: Dear PUSD Community,

Based on recommendations from state and local health and education authorities, the Pasadena Unified School District (PUSD) will extend remote learning through May 28, the last day of school for students. School facilities will not reopen before the end of the academic year due to the coronavirus crisis, but classes will remain in session via remote learning. To be clear, the 2019-2020 school year is not over; it has just transitioned from classroom instruction into distance learning through May 28, 2020, the last day of school for PUSD students.

This is not a decision the Board of Education and I take lightly, but the safety of our students, staff, and families comes first. Public health leaders have made it clear that the peak of this pandemic is yet to come, and physical distancing practices remain vital. Therefore, in accordance with the emergency authorization conferred upon me by the Board of Education and after consulting with each Board member, I have decided to keep campuses physically closed for the remainder of the school year. This allows us to focus on delivering learning in a remote environment.
PUSD had already taken steps in planning for this contingency to make sure that distance learning and essential services continue through the end of the school year.

p.span: After spring break, our District will move to Stage 2 of remote learning from April 6 through April 20. In this phase, teacher-provided content intended for ongoing use will be available via PowerSchool Learning at

. Were modifying content to make sure its achievable by our students given the new remote environment. During this time, teachers will be connecting with students via posted video, discussion and/or assignments in their online classrooms. Students will connect with their teachers online classroom to view and complete assigned material.

div.p: After April 20, PUSD will move to Stage 3, when synchronous learning will occur. Students will be checking in with their teachers routinely, participating in lessons, completing and submitting assignments and tasks.

p.span: We are also very concerned about the social and emotional well-being of all of our students and have set up ways for them to connect with

We also know that many students, especially our seniors, have been looking forward to celebrating promotion and graduation ceremonies. Please know that district leaders will be planning for ways to celebrate these momentous events in different formats and/or at a later date.

div.p: In the coming days and weeks, PUSD will provide families with information regarding how grades, graduation requirements, graduation ceremonies, transcripts, and continued distance learning instruction will be handled.

p.span: Meals are now available seven days a week for students. PUSD continues to provide nutritious Grab and Go meals for children 18 and younger at seven schools weekdays from 9-11 a.m. The City of Pasadena is offering lunch to students and families on weekends from 9-11 a.m. at the same sites.

While we recognize this extension of school facility closures poses challenges and hardship to many families in PUSD, the most effective way to slow and disrupt the transmission of this pandemic is by continuing to implement physical distancing practices. We are grateful to community members throughout our community for their tremendous prevention efforts during this unique and difficult time.

For the remainder of the school year, only school and district personnel who perform essential functions such as feeding children, maintaining facilities, and providing operational continuity as identified by the District are required to come physically to work using Los Angeles Countys guidelines outlined in its

a.span: Safer at Home Public Health Order.

p.span: Please check our website at
for the latest news and information or call the PUSD Family Hotline is 626.396.3680.

While we continue putting into effect the public health orders to Stay Safer Home, I want to assure our students, families, and staff that PUSD will continue to provide vital services such as distance learning, student meals, and social-emotional support for our students. We are ready to serve you and help keep you healthy and safe.
Sincerely,

div.p:
Brian McDonald
Superintendent

p.span: 1 de abril 2020
Estimada comunidad de PUSD:

hr.p: Basado en las recomendaciones de las autoridades estatales y locales de salud y educacin, el Distrito Escolar Unificado de Pasadena (PUSD) extender el aprendizaje remoto hasta el 28 de mayo, el ltimo da de clases para los estudiantes. Las instalaciones escolares no volvern a abrir antes del final del ao acadmico debido a la crisis del coronavirus, pero las clases permanecern en sesin a travs del aprendizaje remoto. Para ser claro, el ao escolar 2019-2020 no ha terminado; est pasando de la instruccin en las aulas al aprendizaje a distancia hasta el 28 de mayo de 2020, el ltimo da de clases para los estudiantes de PUSD.

Esta no es una decisin que la Junta de Educacin y yo tomamos ligeramente, pero la seguridad de nuestros estudiantes, personal y familias es es nuestra primera prioridad. Los lderes de salud pblica han dejado en claro que el pico de esta pandemia an est por llegar, y las prcticas de distanciamiento fsico siguen siendo vitales. Por lo tanto, de acuerdo con la autorizacin de emergencia que me otorg la Mesa Directiva de Educacin y despus de consultar con cada miembro de esta Mesa,he decidido mantener los campus cerrados fsicamente durante el resto del ao escolar. Esto nos permite concentrarnos en brindar aprendizaje en un entorno remoto.
PUSD ya haba tomado medidas para planificar para esta contingencia para asegurar que la educacin a distancia y los servicios esenciales continen hasta el final del ao escolar.

p.span: Despus de las vacaciones de primavera, nuestro Distrito pasar a la Etapa 2 de aprendizaje remoto del 6 al 20 de abril. En esta fase, el contenido proporcionado por el maestro para uso continuo estar disponible a travs de PowerSchool Learning en

. Estamos modificando el contenido para asegurarnos de que nuestros estudiantes puedan lograrlo dado el nuevo entorno remoto. Durante este tiempo, los maestros se conectarn con los estudiantes a travs de videos publicados, debates y / o tareas en sus aulas en lnea. Los estudiantes se conectarn con el aula en lnea de su maestro para ver y completar el material asignado.

hr.p: Despus del 20 de abril, PUSD pasar a la Etapa 3, cuando ocurrir el aprendizaje sincrnico. Los estudiantes se comunicarn de manera rutinaria con sus maestros, participarn en lecciones, completarn y enviarn tareas y tareas.

p.strong: Bienestar Social Emocional de los Estudiantes
p.span: Tambin nos preocupa el bienestar social y emocional de todos nuestros estudiantes y hemos establecido formas para que se conecten con los

Tambin sabemos que muchos estudiantes, especialmente nuestros estudiantes de ltimo ao, han estado esperando celebrar las ceremonias de promocin y graduacin. Tenga en cuenta que los lderes del distrito estarn planeando formas de celebrar estos eventos trascendentales en diferentes formatos y / o en una fecha posterior.

hr.p: En los prximos das y semanas, PUSD proporcionar a las familias informacin sobre cmo se manejarn las calificaciones, los requisitos de graduacin, las ceremonias de graduacin, las transcripciones y la instruccin continua de aprendizaje a distancia.

p.span: Las comidas ahora estn disponibles los siete das de la semana para los estudiantes. PUSD contina brindando comidas nutritivas "Grab and Go" para nios de 18 aos o menos en siete escuelas los das de semana de 9-11 a.m. La Ciudad de Pasadena ofrece almuerzos a estudiantes y familias los fines de semana de 9-11 a.m.en los mismos sitios.

Si bien reconocemos que esta extensin del cierre de las instalaciones escolares plantea desafos y dificultades para muchas familias en el PUSD, la forma ms efectiva de retrasar e interrumpir la transmisin de esta pandemia es continuar implementando prcticas de distanciamiento fsico. Estamos agradecidos con los miembros de la comunidad en toda nuestra comunidad por sus tremendos esfuerzos de prevencin durante este momento nico y difcil.

p.strong: Personal de las escuelas y el distrito
p.span: Durante el resto del ao escolar, solo el personal de la escuela y del distrito que realiza funciones esenciales, como alimentar a los nios, mantener las instalaciones y proporcionar continuidad operativa segn lo identificado por el Distrito, debe trabajar utilizando las pautas del condado de Los ngeles descritas en su

a.span: Orden de salud pblica "ms segura en el hogar

p.span: Visite nuestro sitio web en
para obtener las ltimas noticias e informacin o llame a la lnea directa familiar de PUSD al 626.396.3680.

Si bien seguimos poniendo en vigencia las rdenes de salud pblica para "Mantenerse ms seguros en el hogar", quiero asegurarles a nuestros estudiantes, familias y personal que PUSD continuar brindando los servicios vitales como educacin a distancia, estudiantes comidas y apoyo social-emocional para nuestros estudiantes. Estamos listos para servirle y ayudarle a mantenerse sano y seguro.
Atentamente,

hr.p:
Brian McDonald
Superintendente

p.span: Dear PUSD Community,

div.p: I am pleased to inform you that student meal service at PUSD Grab and Go Food Centers resumes Tuesday, March 31, and will continue weekdays from 9-11 a.m. at seven schools. Using social distancing and public health guidelines, meals will be provided by an outside vendor with the assistance of City of Pasadena volunteers.

In an abundance of caution, we temporarily suspended meal service for today, March 30, after we received a report of a possible COVID-19 case involving a PUSD employee who worked in one of our central kitchens. At this time, the case has not been confirmed.

Following the guidance of the Pasadena Public Health Department, deep cleaning and sanitizing of kitchens and facilities will be conducted, and the employees co-workers were advised of possible exposure. We plan to resume regular meal service by PUSD staff on April 14.

Although we regret the hardship involved with the temporary suspension, we are fully committed to the health and safety of our students, staff, and community. The PUSD team is dedicated to creating solutions on issues affecting students, families, and staff.

p.span: I am so grateful for the strength and commitment demonstrated every day by the employees of PUSD. In times of crises such as the one we are living through now, its clear that heroes dont always wear capes. Instead, they use computers and telephones to teach, answer phones and emails to keep our operations functioning, and prepare meals so that our students and their families continue to receive the essential services they rely on to get through this crisis.

Since yesterdays announcement, offers of help have poured in from civic partners, community organizations, restaurants, and individuals. I am deeply moved and grateful for these offers, and so very proud to be part of this great community.
Please continue to check our website at
and social media for the latest developments.

div.p: Sincerely,

p.span: Brian McDonald
Superintendent
Estimada comunidad de PUSD:

div.p: Me complace informarle que el servicio de comidas para estudiantes en siete escuelas oor "Grab and Go Food Centers" de PUSD se reanuda el martes 31 de marzo y contina de lunes a viernes de 9-11 a.m. en siete escuelas. Usando pautas de distanciamiento social y salud pblica, las comidas sern proporcionadas por un proveedor externo con la asistencia de voluntarios de la Ciudad de Pasadena.

Como precaucin, suspendimos temporalmente el servicio de comidas para hoy, 30 de marzo, despus de recibir un informe de un posible caso de COVID-19 que involucraba a un empleado del PUSD que trabajaba en una de nuestras cocinas centrales. En este momento, el caso no ha sido confirmado.

Siguiendo las indicaciones del Departamento de Salud Pblica de Pasadena, se llevar a cabo una limpieza profunda y desinfeccin de cocinas e instalaciones, y se le inform a los compaeros de trabajo de los empleados sobre una posible exposicin. Planeamos reanudar el servicio regular de comidas por parte del personal del PUSD el 14 de abril.

Aunque lamentamos las dificultades que conlleva la suspensin temporal, estamos totalmente comprometidos a la salud y la seguridad de nuestros estudiantes, el personal y la comunidad. El equipo de PUSD se dedica a crear soluciones para los problemas que afectan a los estudiantes, las familias y el personal.

Estoy muy agradecido por la fortaleza y el compromiso demostrado cada da por los empleados de PUSD. En tiempos de crisis como el que estamos viviendo ahora, est claro que los hroes no siempre usan capas. En cambio, usan computadoras y telfonos para ensear, contestan telfonos y correos electrnicos para mantener nuestras operaciones en funcionamiento, y preparan comidas para que nuestros estudiantes y sus familias continen recibiendo los servicios esenciales en los que confan para superar esta crisis.

Desde el anuncio de ayer, hemos recibido ofertas de ayuda de socios cvicos, organizaciones comunitarias, restaurantes e individuos. Estoy profundamente conmovido y agradecido por estas ofertas, y muy orgulloso de ser parte de esta gran comunidad.

p.span: Contine visitando nuestro sitio web en
y las redes sociales para conocer los ltimos desarrollos.

div.p: Atentamente,

p.span: Brian McDonald
Superintendente

h1.aria-label: March 29, 2020: Student Meal Service Temporarily Suspended
h1.span: March 29, 2020: Student Meal Service Temporarily Suspended

p.span: Dear PUSD Community,
We have received a report that there is a possibility that a PUSD employee at one of our central kitchens may be diagnosed with COVID-19.

Out of an abundance of caution, the Pasadena Unified School Districts (PUSD) Grab and Go student meal service provided at seven school sites is suspended starting Monday, March 30 until later this week.
We know that this may cause hardship to our families and are
working with neighboring school districts to provide meals to PUSD students. We will send you more information as soon as we have confirmation.

The health and safety of our students and staff is our first priority. When we learn of a suspected case in our operations, we follow CDC (Centers for Disease Control) guidelines, inform other staff who may have come into close contact with the staff member, and consult with the local health department to determine appropriate measures.
We are conducting extensive cleaning and sanitizing of our kitchens and facilities to minimize any risk of surface transmission.
As soon as the kitchen and facilities have been fully sanitized, we plan to reopen and provide our students with meals.
We have consulted with the Pasadena Public Health Department, which has advised that the distribution of meals can continue once sanitizing and disinfection is completed.

We share this information in the spirit of transparency, however, we also understand this can cause heightened anxiety among our families. We want you to know that we have taken immediate action according to our planning, and will adjust operations as needed.
While the diagnosis of COVID-19 is not confirmed at this time, our hearts are with our PUSD team member and their family during this very difficult time.
Sincerely,
Brian McDonald
Superintendent
Dear PUSD Community,

div.p: I want to give you an update on PUSDs response to the Coronavirus public health emergency as we all honor the safer at home public health orders. PUSD is committed to providing the vital services that our students and community rely on for as long as this crisis continues and in often rapidly changing conditions.

Schools have been closed for two weeks now, with a probable return date of May 5. Until that time, all non-essential personnel must honor the Safer at Home public health orders. No one is allowed on school sites except for maintenance and operations, custodial staff, and essential personnel as identified by the District during designated times. We will reopen schools based on recommendations from Public Health authorities to make sure that it is safe for students, staff, and families. All sites will have undergone deep cleaning before students and staff return to class.

p.span: With broad community transmission of COVID-19, on March 25, the

a.span: L.A. County Department of Public Health

p.span: issued new public health orders for individuals diagnosed or likely to have COVID-19. To keep our community safe, we must all do our part by staying safer at home.

After spring break, our District will move to Stage 2 of remote learning from April 6 - 20. In this phase, teacher-provided content intended for ongoing use will be available via PowerSchool Learning at gopusd.com/remote. Were modifying content to make sure its achievable by our students given the new remote environment. During this time, teachers will be connecting with students via posted video, discussion and/or assignments in their online classrooms. Students will connect with their teachers online classroom to view and complete assigned material.

To support students and families, PUSD is pushing out a translation extension on our Chromebooks. This will allow words and webpages on PowerSchool Learning to be translated into Spanish and other languages as well.

a.span: Watch this video to see how it works

p.span: Visual arts and music learning activities are loaded to PowerSchool for elementary students. These include lessons for individual instruments for band and orchestra. Videos by our partners at the Pasadena Symphony and Oakwood Brass are being developed for practicing each instrument. These will be posted soon.
GATE Enrichment activities and resources have been added for grades Kindergarten-eighth grade and can be accessed directly by students and parents on their Powerschool student account.

strong.a: Letter from the Special Education Department

p.span: Results of the second lottery of Open Enrollment for 2020-2021 were released today. Parents will need to accept or decline offers by May 1, 2020. Registration will occur once we have more information about reopening school sites. As spots become available, students currently on the waitlist for a school will be automatically advanced based upon their waitlist number. Staff in the Enrollment Office is working remotely but is available to answer your questions or concerns. The best way to reach them is by using the email addresses on the
. Phone messages will be checked each hour and phone calls will be returned as soon as possible.

For spring break, March 30 through April 3, we have developed virtual field trips with global and STEM themes. I encourage you to take time to explore and learn more about the world around us -- virtually. PUSD Virtual field trips are posted on our

Thanks to our 1:1 Tech Equity initiative launched in 2018, we were able to quickly provide devices to students at all grade levels. While we were able to meet the needs of most students, we are working to ensure that every student is able to connect to distance learning.
In the meantime, if you have a PUSD wifi hotspot that you are not using, we ask that you please return it so that we can assign it to a student who does need it.

li.span: Charter Communications will offer free Spectrum broadband and Wi-Fi access for 60 days to households with K-12 and/or college students who do not already have a Spectrum broadband subscription. Installation fees will be waived for new student households. Please be patient during the signup process as I understand the demand is very high. To enroll, call 1-844-488-8395
AT&T is offering low-cost wireline home Internet service.

p.span: Meals are now available seven days a week for students. PUSD continues to provide nutritious Grab and Go meals for children 18 and younger at seven schools weekdays from 9-11 a.m. Im pleased to share that we will continue this service during the upcoming spring break and until schools reopen. The City of Pasadena is offering lunch to students and families on weekends from 9-11 a.m. at the same sites.

PUSD is working with community partners to help families access essential services such as food, shelter, mental health support, and more. I want to especially thank the Pasadena Educational Foundation, Collaborate PASadena, STARS, and PACTL for supporting our students and families.
During challenging times, we see just how much stronger we are together. I am proud to be a part of the Pasadena area community that cares so deeply about one another.
I know how stressful this situation is for our students, parents, staff and community. I want to talk directly to the students of PUSD:

div.p: I know that this time is not easy for you, and that youre probably missing the face-to-face time and activities with your friends and teachers at school. Schools are the places where we connect with learning and with each other. I want you to know that even though you cant see your teachers or fellow students in person, weve set up ways to support you. Everyone here at PUSD is here to help you and continue to prepare you for the future.

p.span: We have help with mental health resources through PUSDs extensive mental health programs.
For support, call ourPUSD Family Hotline at (626) 396-3680. It will connect students with professionals who will link them to the appropriate services and support.
Please check our website at
for updates and new information as changes happen very quickly.
Finally, please remember to follow the Safer at Home public health orders for social distancing and other guidance.

div.p: From classroom teachers and school site staff to central office employees, were all working hard to support our students and their families. All of us working together will get through this as we unite to keep our community healthy and safe.

p.span: Sincerely,

div.p:
Brian McDonald
Superintendent

hr.p: Quiero darle una actualizacin sobre lo que PUSD est haciendo para responder a la emergencia de salud pblica de Coronavirus, ya que todos cumplimos con las rdenes de salud pblica "ms seguras en el hogar". PUSD se compromete a proporcionar los servicios vitales en los que confan nuestros estudiantes y la comunidad, mientras contine esta crisis y, a menudo, en condiciones que cambian rpidamente.

Todas las escuelas y oficinas sern limpiadas profundamente antes de que los estudiantes y el personal regresen a clase.

. Estamos modificando el contenido para asegurarnos de que nuestros estudiantes puedan lograrlo dado el nuevo entorno remoto. p.span: Los resultados de la segunda lotera de Inscripcin Abierta para 2020-2021 se dieron a conocer hoy. Los padres deben aceptar o rechazar las ofertas antes del 1 de mayo de 2020. La inscripcin se realizar una vez que tengamos ms informacin sobre la reapertura de las escuelas. . Los mensajes telefnicos se revisarn cada hora y las llamadas telefnicas se devolvern lo antes posible.

p.span: Para las vacaciones de primavera, del 30 de marzo al 3 de abril, hemos desarrollado excursiones virtuales con temas globales y STEM. Te animo a que te tomes el tiempo para explorar y aprender ms sobre el mundo que nos rodea, virtualmente. Las excursiones virtuales de PUSD se publican en nuestro

Gracias a nuestra iniciativa 1: 1 Tech Equity lanzada en 2018, pudimos proporcionar dispositivos rpidamente a los estudiantes en todos los niveles de grado. Si bien pudimos satisfacer las necesidades de la mayora de los estudiantes, estamos trabajando para garantizar que todos los estudiantes puedan conectarse al aprendizaje a distancia. Mientras tanto, si tiene un punto de acceso wifi PUSD que no est utilizando, le pedimos que lo devuelva para que podamos asignarlo a un estudiante que lo necesite.

PUSD contina proporcionando comidas nutritivas "Grab and Go" para nios de 18 aos y menores en siete escuelas los das de semana de 9-11 a.m. Me complace compartir que continuaremos este servicio durante las prximas vacaciones de primavera y hasta que las escuelas vuelvan a abrir. La ciudad de Pasadena ofrece almuerzos a estudiantes y familias los fines de semana de 9-11 a.m.en los mismos sitios.

p.span: PUSD est trabajando con socios de la comunidad para ayudar a las familias a acceder a servicios esenciales como alimentos, vivienda, apoyo de salud mental y ms. Quiero agradecer especialmente a la Pasadena Educational Foundation, Collaborate PASadena, STARS y PACTL por apoyar a nuestros estudiantes y familias.
Durante tiempos difciles, vemos cun ms fuertes somos juntos. Estoy orgulloso de ser parte de la comunidad del rea de Pasadena que se preocupa tanto por los dems.
S lo estresante que es esta situacin para nuestros estudiantes, padres, personal y comunidad. Quiero hablar directamente con los estudiantes de PUSD:

hr.p: S que esto no es fcil para ustedes y que probablemente est extraando pasar tiempo con sus amigos y maestros en la escuela. Las escuelas son los lugares donde nos conectamos con el aprendizaje y entre nosotros. Quiero que sepan que aunque no pueden ver en persona a sus maestros o compaeros de clase, hemos establecido formas para apoyarlos. Todos en PUSD estmos aqu para ayudarles y continuar preparndolos para el futuro.

para obtener actualizaciones y nueva informacin, ya que los cambios ocurren muy rpidamente.
Finalmente, recuerde seguir las rdenes de salud pblica "Ms seguro en el hogar" para el distanciamiento social y otra orientacin.

h1.aria-label: March 26, 2020 PUSD & City Partner for 7-Day Student Meals
h1.span: March 26, 2020 PUSD & City Partner for 7-Day Student Meals

div.p:
City of Pasadena & Pasadena Unified Partner To Provide Meals for Families 7 Days a Week
Pasadena, CA --- Grab and Go breakfast and lunch service for children 18 and younger will extend to weekends starting March 28, thanks to the continuing partnership between the Pasadena Unified School District (PUSD) and the City of Pasadena. Pre-packed meals are available for pick up at seven PUSD schools from 9 - 11 a.m. Meal service will continue during PUSDs spring recess March 30-April 3, 2020 and until schools reopen.

PUSD began offering the weekday meal service to all children after schools closed to prevent the spread of the Coronavirus (COVID-19). Since the meal service started on March 17, PUSD has served more than 7,000 pre-packaged breakfast and lunches. Grab and Go Food Centers are staffed by PUSD Food Service workers and community volunteers organized by thePasadena Educational Foundation.

Weekend meals are provided through special one-time funding by the Pasadena City Council to address unforeseen and unmet food needs for our PUSD students. The Rose Bowl Operating Company and Pasadena Convention Operating Company are instrumental in supporting with logistical and staff support.

Weekend meal service will be provided by the City of Pasadena at the same seven school sites until classes resume. Meals will follow the same nutritional guidelines as PUSD meals offered during the week.

p.span: I am pleased to partner with the City of Pasadena to extend vital support to our students and families during this time when we are all staying home to protect our community. said Superintendent Brian McDonald. We appreciate our continuing productive relationship with the city, and we are united in our commitment to serving students and their families.

This program is solely for the pick-up of meals as meals cannot be consumed on site. Families are encouraged to continue to be proactive in reducing the risk of COVID-19 by not congregating at the school site once meals have been distributed, continuing to wash their hands often, sneeze or cough into a tissue or their sleeve and stay home if they are sick.

and the
are delivering student meals to homes of children whose parents/caregivers are working, have no transportation or are sick.

La ciudad de Pasadena en Asociacin con El Distrito Escolar Unificado de Pasadena brindarn comidas a las familias los 7 das de la semana

Pasadena, CA --- El servicio de desayuno y almuerzo Grab and Go para nios de 18 aos y menores se extender hasta los fines de semana a partir del 28 de marzo, gracias a la asociacin continua entre el Distrito Escolar Unificado de Pasadena (PUSD) y la Ciudad de Pasadena. Las comidas preenvasadas estn disponibles para recoger en siete escuelas de PUSD de 9 a 11 a.m. El servicio de comidas continuar durante el receso de primavera de PUSD del 30 de marzo al 3 de abril de 2020 yhasta que vuelvan a abrir las escuelas.

div.p: PUSD comenz a ofrecer el servicio de comidas entre semana a todos los nios despus del cierre de las escuelas para evitar la propagacin del Coronavirus (COVID-19). Desde que comenz el servicio de comidas el 17 de marzo, PUSD ha servido ms de 7,000 desayunos y almuerzos preenvasados. Los Centros de Alimentos Grab and Go son atendidos por trabajadores de PUSD Food Service y voluntarios de la comunidad organizados porPasadena Educational Foundation.

Las comidas de fin de semana se proporcionan a travs de fondos especiales por nica vez por la Ciudad de Pasadena para abordar las necesidades de alimentos imprevistas y no satisfechas para nuestros estudiantes de PUSD. La Compaa Operadora Rose Bowl y la Compaa Operadora del Centro de Convenciones de Pasadena son fundamentales para brindar apoyo logstico y de personal.

p.span: La ciudad de Pasadena proporcionar el servicio de comidas los fines de semana en los mismos siete sitios escolares hasta que se reanuden las clases. Las comidas seguirn las mismas pautas nutricionales que las comidas PUSD que se ofrecen durante la semana.

div.p: "Me complace asociarnos con la Ciudad de Pasadena para brindar un apoyo vital a nuestros estudiantes y familias durante este tiempo cuando todos nos quedamos en casa para proteger a nuestra comunidad". dijo el superintendente Brian McDonald. "Apreciamos nuestra continua relacin productiva con la ciudad, y estamos unidos en nuestro compromiso de servir a los estudiantes y sus familias".

Se alienta a las familias a continuar siendo proactivas para reducir el riesgo de COVID-19 al no congregarse en el sitio escolar una vez que se han distribuido las comidas, continuar lavando sus manos con frecuencia, estornudar o toser en un pauelo de papel o la manga y quedarse en casa si estn enfermos.

Dear PUSD Community:

Based on recommendations from the L.A. County Office of Education, Pasadena Unified School District (PUSD) schools will remain closed until May 5. PUSD has already taken steps in planning for this contingency, and is engaged in planning for the closure to be extended.
T

o prevent the spread of the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19) and comply with the States Stay Home and Los Angeles County Safer at Home public health orders, the PUSD Educational Center offices will close effective today.

While we put into effect the public health order to Stay Home and extend the likely date of return, I want to assure our students, families, and staff that PUSD will continue to provide the vital services such as distance learning, student meals, and social-emotion support for our students --- no matter how long it takes. We are ready to serve you and help keep you healthy and safe.
Pending the approval of a federal waiver, it is likely that all California school districts will be ordered to cancel all required assessments for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. The
has canceled the May 2, 2020, SAT and SAT Subject Test administration.

As essential service providers, District and school staff will work remotely, except for identified employees, and continue serving the students and families of PUSD. Teachers and all other non-essential site personnel were released to work remotely earlier this week, in addition to those over 65 years of age and employees with underlying health conditions.
Services will continue with the following modifications:

PUSD ya ha tomado medidas para planificar esta contingencia, y est comprometida a planificar la extensin del cierre.

Para evitar la propagacin de la propagacin del coronavirus (COVID-19) y cumplir con las rdenes de salud pblica del estado "Quedarse en casa" y "Ms seguro en el hogar" del condado de Los ngeles, las oficinas del Centro Educativo del PUSD cerrarn hoy.

Dear PUSD Family,

div.p: Public schools are part of the bedrock of our community and thats why during these unprecedented times, PUSD employees are working to continue delivering the essential services that our children and families rely on. At every level, we as a District have stepped up to make sure that students, families, and community are supported --- no matter how long it takes.

In just days before schools closed to slow the spread of the Coronavirus, the PUSD curriculum team used our existing programs to develop quality instructional content so that student learning can be reinforced at home. This curriculum is already gaining recognition by educators in the region for its forethought and readiness. Yesterday, teachers across PUSD participated in online training to deliver remote learning opportunities for our students. Students began accessing online content today via their secure student accounts.

p.span: Today, our Food Service Department, with the help of volunteers, served

668 meals for children in our community. PUSD is also partnering with the City of Pasadena and local organizations to provide services that support our students and families during this national emergency. Information about this partnership is forthcoming.

I want to share with you one example of the way that Team PUSD is working for students. On March 13, when we decided to close schools, everyone worked to make sure that students went home with Chromebooks and chargers so they had the tools to continue learning at home. With only 45 minutes before the end of the school day, PUSD employees from multiple district offices descended on our warehouse to unpack, sanitize, and deliver chargers to our schools in time for student dismissal.

There are many more stories that show the true and generous spirit of the employees who work in schools day in and day out for our students. We will share more of these stories with you in the coming days.
Please note the information below.

p.strong: All Pasadena Unified schools and programs are dismissed, with no students on campus, through Friday, April 3. Classes will resume on Monday, April 6.

Estimadas familias de PUSD:

Las escuelas pblicas forman parte de la base de nuestra comunidad, y es por eso que durante estos tiempos sin precedentes, los empleados de PUSD estn trabajando para continuar brindando los servicios esenciales en los que confan nuestros estudiantes y sus familias. En todos los niveles, nosotros, como Distrito, hemos dado un paso adelante para asegurar que los estudiantes, las familias y la comunidad reciban apoyo, sin importar cunto tiempo dure esta situacin.

Solo unos das antes de que las escuelas cerrarn para frenar la propagacin del Coronavirus, el equipo del plan de estudios de PUSD utiliz nuestros programas existentes para desarrollar contenido educativo de calidad para que el aprendizaje de los estudiantes pueda reforzarse en casa. Este plan de estudios ya est ganando reconocimiento por parte de los educadores de la regin por su previsin y preparacin. Ayer, los maestros de PUSD participaron en capacitacin en lnea para brindar oportunidades de aprendizaje remoto para nuestros estudiantes. Los estudiantes comenzaron a acceder a contenido en lnea hoy a travs de sus cuentas de estudiantes seguras.

Hoy, nuestro Departamento de Servicio de Alimentos, con la ayuda de voluntarios, sirvi 668 comidas para nios en nuestra comunidad. PUSD tambin se est asociando con la Ciudad de Pasadena y organizaciones locales para proporcionar servicios que apoyen a nuestros estudiantes y familias durante esta emergencia nacional. La informacin sobre esta asociacin ser compartida proximamente.

Quiero compartir con ustedes un ejemplo de la forma en que Team PUSD est trabajando para los estudiantes. El 13 de marzo, cuando decidimos cerrar las escuelas, todo el personal de PUSD trabajaro para asegurarnos de que los estudiantes se fueran a casa con Chromebooks y cargadores para que tuvieran las herramientas para continuar aprendiendo en casa. Con solo 45 minutos antes del final del da escolar, los empleados de PUSD de varias oficinas del distrito descendieron a nuestro almacn para desempacar, desinfectar y entregar cargadores a nuestras escuelas a tiempo para la hora de salida de la escuela para los estudiantes.

Hay muchas ms historias que muestran el verdadero y generoso espritu de los empleados que trabajan en las escuelas da tras da para nuestros estudiantes. Compartiremos ms de estas historias con usted en los prximos das.
Por favor tenga en cuenta la siguiente informacin.

p.span: Los nios y adolescentes pueden sentirse asustados, confundidos o ansiosos al escuchar a los adultos hablar sobre el coronavirus. Los nios y adolescentes reaccionan a la ansiedad y el estrs de manera diferente que los adultos. Algunos pueden reaccionar de inmediato; otros pueden mostrar signos mucho ms tarde de que estn teniendo dificultades. La mejor manera de reducir la preocupacin y la ansiedad es permanecer tranquilo y proveer calma a su nio/a. Los nios reaccionan a lo que dice y cmo lo dice. Est disponible para escuchar y hablar. p.strong: Starting March 16, Pasadena Unified schools will be closed to students through Friday, April 3. Classes resume April 6.

p.span: Dear Families,

Thank you for your understanding and patience as we respond to rapid changes related to the Coronavirus (COVID-19). Its a stressful time for everyone and I want to encourage you to take care of yourself, your families, and each other during these unprecedented times. Our goal is to ensure the safety of our students, families, staff, and community staff by limiting contact and helping to prevent the spread of COVID-19.

We have more details following Fridays announcement. Not every question will be answered here, but we will continue providing additional information in the following days as key points are worked out. Information will be sent to you via email, phone and/or text and will be posted on our
and social media. You may also call our hotline at 626.396.3680.
Starting
p.strong: Monday, March 16, all Pasadena Unified schools and programs will be dismissed, with no students on campus, through Friday, April 3.
p.span: Classes will resume on Monday, April 6.

On Monday, March 16, teachers, administrators, and all other staff are reporting to their assigned work location to prepare for remote learning and to continue to support our students and their families.

The Pasadena Unified School District Food and Nutrition Department will be providing an opportunity for families to drive through and pick up free pre-packed breakfast and lunch for students 18 and younger who need them during the school closure. The meals will be at seven campuses starting March 17 - March 27, 2020 (9 - 11 a.m. Monday-Friday).

li.span: During this time, we are conducting a deep cleaning of schools so that everyone will have a safe environment when classes resume for students.
School and district staff will be working to support the delivery of remote reinforcement of learning and students and their families. We will also be preparing for students to return to school.

p.span: I fully understand that you are experiencing a major disruption in your lives, and I want you to know that we are here to support you in any way we can. The Pasadena Unified community is remarkable for its strength and resilience, and I know that acting together with compassion and understanding, we will get through this.

We are heartened by the many offers of help from our exceptional Pasadena area community. Organizations and individuals are coming forward with offers of donations, supplies, and support for our most vulnerable students. We sincerely thank you and want you to know that were setting up systems so that we can provide avenues for your incredible generosity to make the best use of donations. We will share information with you soon.
Sincerely,
Brian McDonald
Superintendent

p.strong: A partir del 16 de marzo, las escuelas del Distrito Escolar Unificado de Pasadena (PUSD) permanecern cerradas para los estudiantes hasta el viernes 3 de abril. Las clases se reanudarn el 6 de abril.

p.span: Estimadas familias,

Gracias por su comprensin y paciencia mientras respondemos a los rpidos cambios relacionados con el Coronavirus (COVID-19). Es un momento estresante para todos y quiero alentarlos a que se cuiden a s mismos, a sus familias y a los dems durante estos tiempos sin precedentes. Nuestro objetivo es garantizar la seguridad de nuestros estudiantes, familias y personal, y comunidad limitando el contacto y ayudando a prevenir la propagacin de COVID-19.

Tenemos ms detalles despus del anuncio del viernes. No todas las preguntas tendrn respuesta aqu, pero continuaremos brindando informacin adicional en los das siguientes a medida que se resuelvan los puntos clave. La informacin se le enviar por correo electrnico, telfono y / o texto y se publicar en nuestro sitio
y en las redes sociales. Tambin puede llamar a nuestra lnea directa al 626.396.3680.

p.strong: A partir del lunes 16 de marzo, todas las escuelas y programas del PUSD sern despedidos, sin estudiantes en el campus, hasta el viernes 3 de abril. Las clases se reanudarn el lunes 6 de abril.

p.span: El lunes 16 de marzo, los maestros, administradores y todo el resto del personal se reportan a su ubicacin de trabajo asignada para prepararse para el aprendizaje remoto y continuar apoyando a nuestros estudiantes y sus familias.

El Departamento de Alimentos y Nutricin del Distrito Escolar Unificado de Pasadena brindar una oportunidad para que las familias conduzcan y recojan desayuno y almuerzo preempaquetado gratis para estudiantes de 18 aos y menores que los necesiten durante el cierre de la escuela. Las comidas sern en siete campus a partir del 17 de marzo al 27 de marzo de 2020 (de 9 a 11 a.m. de lunes a viernes).

li.span: Field Elementary
Madison Elementary
Norma Coombs Elementary
Eliot Middle School
Wilson Middle School
McKinley TK-8 School
John Muir High School

p.span: * La recogida en el vehculo ser en el estacionamiento o en los carriles para dejar a los estudiantes en cada escuela.
si tiene un nio que recibe algn tipo de servicios de educacin especial, los estudiantes tendrn acceso al refuerzo del aprendizaje de forma remota. Se puede acceder a los materiales en
. En la mayor medida posible, el Distrito proporcionar algunos servicios de teleterapia. Habr ms informacin del Departamento de Educacin Especial.

p.strong: Abordar las preocupaciones sobre el coronavirus
p.span: : los nios y adolescentes pueden sentirse asustados, confundidos o ansiosos al escuchar a los adultos hablar sobre el coronavirus. Es importante durante estos tiempos turbulentos apoyar su bienestar.

a.span: Los Servicios de Apoyo Escolar del PUSD han preparado la Gua para padres / cuidadores para ayudar a las familias a enfrentar la enfermedad del coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19)

p.span: : estamos explorando activamente formas de asociarnos con otras agencias y proporcionar cuidado de nios y supervisin para las familias de PUSD durante este tiempo. Le informaremos tan pronto como algo sea definitivo.

Para mantener nuestro valor fundamental de equidad en el aprendizaje, PUSD proporcionar refuerzo del aprendizaje de forma remota para todos los estudiantes, incluidos los estudiantes con discapacidades. Tendrn acceso a los materiales en
antes del lunes 16 de marzo. Carta detallada para padres aqu.

hr.p: Etapa 1-16-27 de marzo

ul.li: Contenido general para K-12 en PowerSchool engopusd.com/remote. El sitio se activa el 16 de marzo. Inicie sesin con la cuenta de estudiante protegida de PUSD de su hijo (s).
Los estudiantes de K-12 se fueron a casa con Chromebooks y cargadores el viernes.
Los estudiantes de K-5 que necesitan Chromebooks o cargadores pueden recogerlos en sus escuelas primarias el lunes.
Un nmero limitado de paquetes impresos estar disponible en las escuelas el lunes.

p.strong: 30 de marzo - 3 de abril Receso de Primavera

p.br:
Si es necesario ms all del 3 de abril
Contenido provisto por el maestro para uso continuo a travs de PowerSchool

hr.p: Etapa 3 El aprendizaje a distancia puede ser necesario en caso de aprendizaje remoto prolongado. Se proporcionarn detalles a medida que evolucione la situacin.

p.span: Queremos informar a nuestras familias que:

li.span: Charter Communications ofrecer acceso gratuito de banda ancha y Wi-Fi de Spectrum durante 60 das a hogares con estudiantes de K-12 y / o estudiantes universitarios que an no tienen una suscripcin de banda ancha de Spectrum. Las tarifas de instalacin no se aplicarn a los nuevos hogares de estudiantes. Para inscribirse, llame al 1-844-488-8395
AT&T ofrece un servicio de Internet residencial de bajo costo.
Durante este tiempo, estamos llevando a cabo una limpieza profunda de las escuelas para que todos tengan un ambiente seguro cuando las clases se reanuden para los estudiantes.

El personal de la escuela y el distrito trabajar para apoyar la entrega de refuerzo remoto del aprendizaje y los estudiantes y sus familias. Tambin nos estaremos preparando para que los estudiantes regresen a la escuela.

p.span: Entiendo completamente que estn experimentando una interrupcin grande en sus vidas, y quiero que sepan que estamos aqu para apoyarlos en todo lo que podamos. La comunidad de nuestro distrito de Pasadena es notable por su fuerza y resistencia, y s que actuando juntos, con compasin y comprensin, superaremos esto.

Nos alientan las numerosas ofertas de ayuda de nuestra excepcional comunidad de Pasadena. Organizaciones e individuos estn presentando ofertas de donaciones, suministros y apoyo para nuestros estudiantes ms vulnerables. Le agradecemos sinceramente y queremos que sepa que estamos configurando sistemas para que podamos proporcionarle vas para su increble generosidad para aprovechar al mximo las donaciones. Compartiremos informacin con usted pronto.
Atentamente,
Brian McDonald
Superintendente

h1.aria-label: March 13, 2020 PUSD Schools to Dismiss due to COVID-19
h1.span: March 13, 2020 PUSD Schools to Dismiss due to COVID-19

div.p: March 13, 2020
Dear Pasadena Unified staff, families, and community,

p.span: In an abundance of caution and in response to widening concerns about COVID-19, all Pasadena Unified School District (PUSD) students will be

from attending school on Monday, March 16, 2020; staff will report on Monday, March 16, but no students will be present. This includes all schools and programs in Pasadena Unified including childrens centers, preschools, grades TK-12, and our adult school. Staff will receive additional instructions from your school administrator or director later today.
Schools remain

with no students on any campuses from Tuesday, March 17 through April 5, 2020. Schools will reopen for students on April 6, 2020 barring any further developments. Schools will undergo a deep cleaning during the closure period. Staff will continue to report to their assigned work location until notified otherwise by the District.

div.p: Instruction will continue during the closure period of March 17 - April 5, and accommodations are being made for students with disabilities. We are preparing instruction in three phases:

li.span: Standards-based general content packets via Powerschool that will be live on Monday. We will send further details this weekend;
Digital push-out with additional content using Powerschool Online Classrooms, and
Distance learning with two-way flow of work between students and teachers is in development in case it is needed.

div.p: We will be providing additional information about services for students with disabilities.

p.span: School meals will continue to be provided for students starting Tuesday, March 17. Information and locations is posted

div.p: We are taking this proactive step to protect our students, staff, families, and communities.

p.span: We will continue our frequent communications with you.
Please visit ourdedicated Coronavirus webpagefor all of our previous communication or call our hotline at 626-396-3680.
Please stay healthy.

div.p: Sincerely,

p.span: Brian McDonald
Superintendent
13 de marzo de 2020
Estimado personal, familias y comunidad del Distrito Unificado de Pasadena,

Con mucha precaucin y en respuesta a las crecientes preocupaciones sobre COVID-19, todos los estudiantes del Distrito Escolar Unificado de Pasadena (PUSD) sern excusados de asistir a la escuela el lunes 16 de marzo de 2020; El personal se presentara a trabajar el lunes 16 de marzo, pero no habr estudiantes. Esto incluye todas las escuelas y programas en el Unificado de Pasadena, incluido el centro para nios, preescolar, grados TK-12 y nuestra escuela para adultos. El personal recibir instrucciones adicionales del administrador o director de su escuela durante del da de hoy ms tarde.

Las escuelas permanecen cerradas sin campus de estudiantes desde el martes 17 de marzo hasta el 5 de abril de 2020. Las escuelas volvern a abrir para los estudiantes el 6 de abril de 2020, salvo que se desarrollen ms. Las escuelas se sometern a una limpieza profunda durante el perodo de cierre. El personal continuar reportndose a su ubicacin de trabajo asignada hasta que el Distrito notifique lo contrario.
La instruccin continuar durante el perodo de cierre del 17 de marzo al 5 de abril, y se harn adaptaciones para los estudiantes con discapacidades. Estamos preparando la instruccin en tres fases:

li.span: Paquetes de contenido general basados en estndares a travs de Powerschool que estarn en vivo el lunes. Le enviaremos ms detalles este fin de semana.

ol.li: Push-out digital con contenido adicional usando Powerschool Online Classrooms,y

li.span: El aprendizaje a distancia con flujo de trabajo bidireccional entre estudiantes y maestros est en desarrollo en caso de que sea necesario.

hr.p: Proporcionaremos informacin adicional sobre los servicios para estudiantes con discapacidades.

p.span: Las comidas escolares se seguirn brindando a los estudiantes a partir del martes 17 de marzo. Aqu se publica informacin y ubicaciones.

hr.p: Estamos tomando este paso proactivo para proteger a nuestros estudiantes, personal, familias y comunidades.
Continuaremos nuestras frecuentes comunicaciones con usted.
Visitenuestra pgina web dedicada de Coronaviruspara todas nuestras comunicaciones anteriores o llame a nuestra lnea directa al 626-396-3680
Por favor mantngase saludable.
Sinceramente,

p.span: Brian McDonald
Superintendente
